content.description: Start sitting/crouching with the left hand utilizing a layback feature/sidepull at 3.5 feet and the right hand on a sloper just to the right. Move to a good hold above and use it to gain the lip. Follow the lip rightwards, topping out when convenient.
content.protection: One pad, though a pad is not necessary.
content.location: This is located on the left side of the east face of the boulder. It is the blue line in the topo photo.

content.description: Start sitting with the right hand on a slopey sidepull at 3 feet and the left hand on an edge a bit lower. Pull off the ground with difficulty and use some slopers to gain better holds on the slab. Short and a bit awkward.
content.protection: One pad, though a pad is not necessary.
content.location: Located on the right side of the west face of the boulder. This is the yellow line in the topo photo.

content.description: This decent sized boulder is unfortunately weirdly shaped which makes the climbing opportunities on it limited. However, there are a couple of okay problems and potential for more variations. This boulder must be climbed within an hour or two of low tide. It is under water at high tide.
